channel.title: Linux distros... Hmm
channel.description:
Ubuntu, Kubuntu, etc:
They work very well for me except for the fact that it does not shut down properly (even when it shuts down the computer, it is still giving out power, which is wasting the battery/more electric)
Is there any distro that doesn't do that? I'm downloading Sabayon right now to see if that one works better, please enlighten me!

item.title: Linux distros... Hmm
item.dc:creator: @bjc22 bjc22
item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

Oh I tried Sabayon a few hours after I posted this and it is actually shutting the computers down properly. So don’t worry bout this.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux distros... Hmm
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

I have no idea what you are talking about. Are you sure you’re turning it off (have you disabled acpi with noacpi to get it to boot?)

Read full topic

item.title: Linux distros... Hmm
item.dc:creator: @bjc22 bjc22
item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

Nope I know the computer is off, but it seems to still be giving power. Like for my desktop for example, after I shut it down, the light is off, when it is on stand-by the light blinks. But after I shut it down, and I unplug the power cord and plug it back in it automatically turns back on. It’s very weird.

And it only does it with the linux distros that I have tried.

In windows when I shut it down, and unplug the power cord and plug it back in it doesn’t turn back on. But in Windows if I hold the power button down and have an emergency shutdown like that, and unplug it and plug it back in then it automatically turns back on.

So i’m thinking the linux distros aren’t shutting it down properly?

I honestly can’t stand windows, and I love linux but theres just minor problems like that that prevent me from using it long-term :\

Read full topic

item.title: Linux distros... Hmm
item.dc:creator: @Cruzer Cruzer
item.description:
@Cruzer wrote:

You probably aren’t shutting it down… you might be putting it in standby instead.

Read full topic
